thread.title: Cross country: Johnson boys, North Hall girls claim Hall County titles
thread.title_full: Cross country: Johnson boys, North Hall girls claim Hall County titles

author: AccessWDUN Staff
title: Cross country: Johnson boys, North Hall girls claim Hall County titles
text:
By AccessWDUN Staff Related Articles Cross country: North Hall sweeps West Hall Inv., as Gearing scorches course Cross country: North Hall boys, White County girls take War Eagle Invitational Surprising Tigers looking to take early lead in 7-AAA Falcons downplay White's complaints about lack of passes 
GAINESVILLE — Johnson’s boys took first place individually and as a team, while North Hall’s girls did the same on Wednesday at the Hall County Cross County Championships at Chestatee High in Gainesville. 
Gerardo Suarez crossed the finish line in 16 minutes, 7 seconds to claim a gold medal for the Knights, while Isaac Hernandez took third (16:34), Javier Gonzalez eighth (17:50) and Luis Razo ninth (17:52). 
Their performances helped Johnson to edge out North Hall by two points, as the Trojans also notched four spots in the top 10 -- led by Corson Teasley’s second place finish (16:28). Tommy Johnson also took fourth (16:48), Eli Parker sixth (17:28) and Devon Crow 10th (17:55). 
Chestatee finished third as a team, led by a fifth place finish from Ivan Martin (17:11). West Hall was fourth, Gainesville fifth (Alex Sosa was seventh, 17:45), Lakeview sixth, East Hall seventh and Riverside Military eighth. 
On the girls side, Mattie Bohanan finished first to pace the field and the Lady Trojans (21:01), while teammate Georgina Hoffman was just behind in second (21:14). Hennebry Waters also finished seveth (21:46) and Mary McGarry 10th (22:15). 
Their performances were enough to push past Johnson in second place. Evelin Avitia led the Lady Knights in fourth place (21:36). Hannah Rogers was also fifth (21:38), Molly Hayes sixth (21:42) and Arisbel Saucedo ninth (21:52). 
Chestatee finished third, as Abbie Cliche also took third individually (21:25) and Megan Dew eighth (21:49). Lakeview Academy was fourth, Gainesville fifth and West Hall sixth. Associated Tags : High school cross country © Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com
